ticket.title: i18n routes can't be recognized
ticket.original-body:
Rails (2.3.5 and it seems the same is with edge) with Ruby 1.9 correctly creates and stores utf-8 based routes. But when it comes to route recognition, it fails to match the route name:
@@@ ruby map.home 'начало', controller: :home, action: :index @@@
then http://localhost/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE gives @@@ No route matches "/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE" with {:method=>:get} @@@
The reason is that recognize_path does html unescape only after routes are mapped, and because of this it fails to map raw utf8 stored name against its %XX%XX equivalent.
In 2.3.5 the next patch fixes the issue:
@@@ ruby require 'action_pack' require 'cgi' module ActionController::Routing class RouteSet alias_method :recognize_path_ugly, :recognize_path
def recognize_path(path, environment) path = CGI::unescape(path).force_encoding('utf-8').encode(invalid: :replace) recognize_path_ugly(path, environment) end end end @@@
The problem was introduced with http://dev.rubyonrails.org/changeset/6185 which basically tried to fix another issue. Actually fixing it with the above patch will break the current behaviour of parameters unescaping, so it should be carefully considered.
The similar issue was raised which also may interfere with this problem: https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/2574-routing-double-escape-url-segments
ticket.latest-body:
Rails (2.3.5 and it seems the same is with edge) with Ruby 1.9 correctly creates and stores utf-8 based routes. But when it comes to route recognition, it fails to match the route name:
@@@ ruby map.home 'начало', controller: :home, action: :index @@@
then http://localhost/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE gives @@@ No route matches "/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE" with {:method=>:get} @@@
The reason is that recognize_path does html unescape only after routes are mapped, and because of this it fails to map raw utf8 stored name against its %XX%XX equivalent.
In 2.3.5 the next patch fixes the issue:
@@@ ruby require 'action_pack' require 'cgi' module ActionController::Routing class RouteSet alias_method :recognize_path_ugly, :recognize_path
def recognize_path(path, environment) path = CGI::unescape(path).force_encoding('utf-8').encode(invalid: :replace) recognize_path_ugly(path, environment) end end end @@@
The problem was introduced with http://dev.rubyonrails.org/changeset/6185 which basically tried to fix another issue. Actually fixing it with the above patch will break the current behaviour of parameters unescaping, so it should be carefully considered.
The similar issue was raised which also may interfere with this problem: https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/2574-routing-double-escape-url-segments
ticket.original-body-html:
Rails (2.3.5 and it seems the same is with edge) with Ruby 1.9 correctly creates and stores utf-8 based routes. But when it comes to route recognition, it fails to match the route name:

map.home 'начало', controller: :home, action: :index

then
http://localhost/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE
gives

No route matches "/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE" with {:method=>:get}

The reason is that recognize_path does html unescape only after routes are mapped, and because of this it fails to map raw utf8 stored name against its %XX%XX equivalent.

In 2.3.5 the next patch fixes the issue:

require 'action_pack'
require 'cgi'
module ActionController::Routing
  class RouteSet
    alias_method :recognize_path_ugly, :recognize_path

    def recognize_path(path, environment)
      path = CGI::unescape(path).force_encoding('utf-8').encode(invalid: :replace)
      recognize_path_ugly(path, environment)
    end
  end
end

The problem was introduced with http://dev.rubyonrails.org/changeset/6185 which basically tried to fix another issue. Actually fixing it with the above patch will break the current behaviour of parameters unescaping, so it should be carefully considered.

The similar issue was raised which also may interfere with this problem:
https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/2574-routing-...

version.body:
Rails (2.3.5 and it seems the same is with edge) with Ruby 1.9 correctly creates and stores utf-8 based routes. But when it comes to route recognition, it fails to match the route name:
@@@ ruby map.home 'начало', controller: :home, action: :index @@@
then http://localhost/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE gives @@@ No route matches "/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE" with {:method=>:get} @@@
The reason is that recognize_path does html unescape only after routes are mapped, and because of this it fails to map raw utf8 stored name against its %XX%XX equivalent.
In 2.3.5 the next patch fixes the issue:
@@@ ruby require 'action_pack' require 'cgi' module ActionController::Routing class RouteSet alias_method :recognize_path_ugly, :recognize_path
def recognize_path(path, environment) path = CGI::unescape(path).force_encoding('utf-8').encode(invalid: :replace) recognize_path_ugly(path, environment) end end end @@@
The problem was introduced with http://dev.rubyonrails.org/changeset/6185 which basically tried to fix another issue. Actually fixing it with the above patch will break the current behaviour of parameters unescaping, so it should be carefully considered.
The similar issue was raised which also may interfere with this problem: https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/2574-routing-double-escape-url-segments
version.body-html:
Rails (2.3.5 and it seems the same is with edge) with Ruby 1.9 correctly creates and stores utf-8 based routes. But when it comes to route recognition, it fails to match the route name:

map.home 'начало', controller: :home, action: :index

then
http://localhost/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE
gives

No route matches "/%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%87%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE" with {:method=>:get}

The reason is that recognize_path does html unescape only after routes are mapped, and because of this it fails to map raw utf8 stored name against its %XX%XX equivalent.

In 2.3.5 the next patch fixes the issue:

require 'action_pack'
require 'cgi'
module ActionController::Routing
  class RouteSet
    alias_method :recognize_path_ugly, :recognize_path

    def recognize_path(path, environment)
      path = CGI::unescape(path).force_encoding('utf-8').encode(invalid: :replace)
      recognize_path_ugly(path, environment)
    end
  end
end

The problem was introduced with http://dev.rubyonrails.org/changeset/6185 which basically tried to fix another issue. Actually fixing it with the above patch will break the current behaviour of parameters unescaping, so it should be carefully considered.

The similar issue was raised which also may interfere with this problem:
https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/2574-routing-...

version.body: With the increasing support for IDN in browsers this is probably something we want to address.
version.body-html: With the increasing support for IDN in browsers this is probably something we want to address.
